intro: Justicia scheidweileri, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. The plant is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and butterflies.
